name: Primevalion
description:
A project that started as an actual tabletop game before being converted into a PC title. In summary, 4 players represented by fantasy monsters battle for control of the center of the board. Pieces standing on any of the four central tiles will collect resources every turn; the first player to reach 2000 resources wins the match.

CONTROLS

- Mouse left button: click to select a piece/move/attack an enemy piece.

- Mouse right button or arrow keys: adjust the camera.

- Mouse wheel: scroll to zoom in or out.

RULES

- Turn order is randomized at the beginning of the match.

- A player can move all of their available pieces during their turn, or finish early by pressing the "End Turn" button.

- Movement is performed by clicking on a piece, then clicking on an adjacent tile.

- Moving over friendly or enemy pieces will push them to the next adjacent tile. There is no limit to how many aligned pieces can be pushed at once.

- Enemy pieces standing in a diagonal tile can be attacked, which removes them from the board and takes their position.

- Pieces can also be removed from the board by pushing them into a pit.

- Any pieces removed from the board are revived at the beginning of their owner's turn, back at their starting positions. Pieces cannot move on the same turn they are revived.

- Each monster race has a special ability which activates under certain conditions and changes the rules of the game. Consult the in-game Tutorial for more information.

ADDITIONAL INFO

Click the small red button beside each player on the title screen to activate AI controls or disable a player entirely. The game can be enjoyed by up to 4 players locally, hot-seat style, by alternating turns on the same device.

CREDITS

- Programming by Grégory Torres and Newton Brandalize Júnior

- Art by Grégory Torres and Fabrício Farias Aragão

- Sound effects downloaded from Freesounds.org
